Title: Pavitra Jayaram death: Kannada TV actress, known for 'Trinayani,' passes away due to tragic car crash
Description: Pavitra Jayaram, a popular Kannada and Telugu television actress, died in a road accident near Mehbooba Nagar in Andhra Pradesh. The accident took place on the outskirts of Hyderabad on Wednesday morning. Pavitra was travelling with her family and driver when their car collided with a lorry. She died on the spot. Her family members and driver sustained injuries. Pavitra was best known for her role in the popular Kannada serial 'Trinayani'. She had also acted in several Telugu serials. Her death has sent shockwaves across the Kannada and Telugu film industries. Fans and colleagues have taken to social media to express their grief. Pavitra's legacy as a gifted actress and a kind-hearted individual will continue to inspire people for years to come.

Title: SC asks Maharashtra govt to 'forthwith' conduct safety audit of Bombay High Court building
Description: The Supreme Court has directed the Maharashtra government to audit the Bombay High Court building and expedite drawings for a new high court in Mumbai. Chief Justice D Y Chandrachud stressed the need for prompt government action and highlighted the issue of staff relocation.

Title: ET Road Safety & Safer Mobility Forum: Experts spotlight strategies for elevating employee well-being and operational efficiency in transportation
Description: Global road fatalities dropped by 5%, but India saw a 15% rise. The ET Road Safety & Safer Mobility Forum discussed safety culture and technology's role in employee transportation. Leaders emphasized driver safety, tech integration, and collaborative efforts for a safer future.

Title: Directorate of Education has zero-tolerance policy, doing best to deal with bomb threats to schools, Delhi HC told
Description: The Directorate of Education has responded to concerns raised in a petition regarding bomb threats by ensuring strict implementation of safety guidelines in schools. They follow a zero-tolerance policy, conducting safety walks, mock drills, and emphasizing the importance of student safety.

Title: China trying to undermine Tibet's identity, want to make world aware about it: Tibetan girl who was jailed for protesting
Description: A Tibetan girl who trekked for 10 days to reach India from Tibet last year to highlight the alleged Chinese repression in the region is now studying at an educational institution run by the Tibetan government-in-exile in Himachal Pradesh's Dharamshala.

Title: Workplace injury reports show slight rise among top 1,000 listed companies
Description:
**Prime Database data shows 5,244 work-related injuries to white-collar employees in 2022-23**

According to recent data from Prime Database, shared exclusively with ET, 268 companies reported 5,244 work-related injuries to white-collar employees in 2022-23, compared to 392 companies reporting 9,867 injuries to blue-collar workers during the financial year.

Title: Stunts for clicks: How reckless Delhi Instagrammers are flouting laws and common sense for likes & followers
Description: Delhi's Instagram influencers are taking dangerous risks for online fame, flouting laws and risking lives for likes. Police crackdowns are increasing, with fines and arrests on the rise. Experts note the allure of glamour and urge stricter measures. Public vigilance is growing, leading to more reporting and consequences. Influencers must prioritize safety over sensationalism in their quest for social media stardom.

Title: Avtar Saini, ex-Intel chief, dies while cycling: What to keep in mind when cycling on road. 10 safety tips that can save your life
Description: Avtar Saini, former head of Intel India and a key contributor to the design of the Intel Pentium processor, died in a cycling accident on Palm Beach Road in Nerul, Navi Mumbai. Saini was hit by a cab despite wearing a helmet and succumbed to his injuries. The driver of the cab attempted to flee but was caught. The incident has sparked discussions on cycling safety, emphasizing the importance of helmet use, visibility, traffic rules adherence, vigilance, safe routes, bike maintenance, and emergency preparedness.

Title: 'Zero fatality corridor': Crash deaths down by 58.3% on Mumbai-Pune E-way since 2016, says report
Description: The Mumbai-Pune Expressway has seen a marked decline in road crash deaths since the launch of the "zero fatality corridor" initiative in 2016, a joint effort of the Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation (MSRDC), the Maharashtra Highway Police (HSP), the Maharashtra Motor Vehicle Department and the SaveLIFE Foundation.

Title: The “zero fatality corridor" that cut road fatalities on Mumbai-Pune Expressway by half
Description: A report has highlighted the success of the "zero fatality corridor" initiative on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway, revealing a 58.3% reduction in road crash fatalities since 2016 and a 32% decrease since 2022. The initiative, a collaboration between various agencies, focuses on the 5Es of Road Safety: Enactment, Engineering, Enforcement, Emergency Care, and Engagement.

Title: Navigating Safer Roads: AI and Technology Transforming Fleet Safety in the Oil and Gas Sector
Description:
The ET Road Safety & Safer Mobility Forum 2023 brought together industry leaders to discuss AI-driven solutions, legislation, and the need for education to elevate road safety in the oil and gas sector.

Speakers from across the industry shared their insights on how to improve road safety, including the use of AI to monitor driver behavior, the need for stricter legislation, and the importance of educating drivers on the risks of distracted driving.

The forum also featured a panel discussion on the future of road safety, in which experts discussed how new technologies and innovations could be used to make roads safer.

The forum concluded with a call to action for all stakeholders to work together to improve road safety and create a safer future for everyone.

Title: Road Ministry to award projects on quality-cum-cost basis: Nitin Gadkari
Description: Addressing a conference on road safety, Gadkari said the ministry will do away with the process of giving contracts to the lowest bidder and instead go for a quality and cost based selection process (QCBS). The move is aimed at improving the quality of road construction and enhancing safety.

Title: Road ministry to come up with cashless treatment for accident victims
Description: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways is working towards halving the number of deaths and injuries from road accidents by 2030. It aims to address the remaining 5000 black spots on national highways by May 2025 and has also introduced a cashless treatment scheme for accident victims.

Title: Govt aims to reduce road accident deaths by 50% by 2030: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari
Description: Road safety is the government's top priority, with the aim of reducing accident deaths by 50% by 2030. The increase in road accidents and deaths leads to a socio-economic loss of 3.14% to GDP. 60% of deaths occur in the young age group of 18 to 35 years. The minister emphasized the importance of changing social behavior and strengthening the '4Es of road safety' - engineering, enforcement, education, and emergency medical service.

Title: SC asks Centre to consider enhancing compensation in hit-and-run accidents
Description: The Supreme Court has directed the Centre to consider enhancing compensation amounts in hit-and-run accidents. The court wants the government to review and possibly increase the compensation amounts annually. The court also instructed the police to inform the victims' families about the compensation scheme.

Title: You could be jailed for letting your kid drive scooter or car in UP
Description:
The Uttar Pradesh government has banned individuals under the age of 18 from driving scooters and cars. The move is aimed at curbing road accidents involving minors. Parents who permit their children to drive will face penalties.

Strict measures will be enforced in secondary schools to raise awareness and educate students on road safety. Each school will establish a road safety club with a student appointed as the Road Safety Captain. Designated teachers will receive training, and guidelines have been issued by the Transport Commissioner.

Title: 'New hit-and-run law devised to alert vehicle drivers, ensure safety of passengers,' MoS Road Transport VK Singh
Description: The new laws have been made to alert the vehicle drivers and for the safety of the passengers. The new law has been devised to help the passengers. Earlier drivers used to run away, now a new law has been made to alert the drivers and for the safety of the passengers.

Title: Union Transport Minister aims for India's road infrastructure to match US in next 5 years
Description: India aims to match US road infrastructure within five years, says Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari. The government plans to alleviate metro congestion, reduce travel time, and minimize road accidents. Gadkari highlighted the transparent, time-bound, and quality-conscious decision-making process, emphasizing the importance of robust infrastructure for attracting investment.

Title: Bengaluru techies, follow traffic rules or your firm will be notified about your violations
Description: The east division of Bengaluru Traffic Police has started a unique drive on a pilot basis along the city's Information Technology corridor covering the Outer Ring Road and Whitefield. The drive aims to raise awareness about road safety and traffic rules.

Title: ET Road Safety & Safer Mobility Forum 2023: Promoting the Path to Global Road-Safety Standards with AI and Advanced Technology
Description: The Economic Times, supported by Netradyne, a global leader in vision-based driver safety and management solutions, presents the third edition of the ET Road Safety & Safer Mobility Forum 2023. The forum will be held on March 15, 2023, at the Taj Mahal Hotel, New Delhi.

Title: Plans afoot to rope in experts from IITs for tunnel audit team
Description: The government is planning to form an audit team with experts from various IITs and set up a world-class tunnelling centre under IIT Delhi to research and propose enhanced safety measures for tunnels that are benchmarked to international levels. The move is aimed at preventing recurrence of mishaps like the recent Silkyara tunnel collapse in Uttarakhand in future.

Title: Centre plans to introduce cashless treatment of accident victims across India, says MoRTH Secy
Description: The Road Transport and Highways Ministry will fully implement the provision of free and cashless medical treatment to accident-injured victims across the nation in collaboration with the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.

Title: Cashless medical treatment for road accident victims in 3-4 months: Road Secretary
Description: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) in India plans to roll out cashless medical treatment for all road accident victims nationwide within the next three to four months. This initiative, part of the amended Motor Vehicle Act 2019, aims to provide free and cashless medical treatment to accident victims, including during the critical "golden hour" following a traumatic injury.

Title: Now, Angelo Mathews' helmet in transport department's awareness campaign
Description: The Odisha State Transport Authority (STA) has used the controversial cricket incident involving Angelo Mathews to promote road safety awareness. The STA shared a post on social media with the message, "Bad quality helmets can take your wicket," emphasizing the importance of wearing certified helmets.

Title: India committed to achieving global road safety targets set in Stockholm Declaration: Nitin Gadkari
Description: Gadkari, while addressing the ministerial session focusing on road safety at the 27th World Road Congress in Prague, Czech Republic, emphasized on adopting a holistic approach to minimise road crashes and fatalities by stakeholders at all levels. The road transport and highways minister reiterated the country's special focus on spreading awareness to effect behavioral change and ensuring flawless enforcement of rules.

Title: Netradyne’s ultratech road safety solutions for Indian fleet owners, Make in India dynamics and more
Description: As India is transitioning to sustainable and inclusive mobility, safe mobility has emerged as a top priority, given the country’s record number of road fatalities. David Julian, the CTO at Netradyne, takes us on a tech-powered track paving the way for next-generation safe mobility solutions in India through vision-based technology ‘Driver•i’ and other innovations.

Title: Maharashtra govt's road safety corpus is Rs 823 cr but actual spend just Rs 65 cr: Data
Description: The state government announced to set up RSF to raise the corpus by levying a cess collected at the time of vehicle buying and a high-power committee for monitoring the fund in September 2016.

Title: Maruti Suzuki India working on various initiatives to make roads safer: Company official
Description: Maruti Suzuki's automated driving test track at Lado Sarai was inaugurated by Delhi Government Principal Secretary for Transport Ashish Kundra on Friday.

Title: Driving road safety awareness as India reaffirms commitment to reduction in road fatalities and injuries
Description: India's Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari has called for a 50% reduction in road accidents by the end of 2025. He said that the government is working on a number of measures to improve road safety, including better enforcement of traffic laws, improving road infrastructure, and educating drivers and pedestrians. Gadkari also said that the government is considering introducing a new law that would make it mandatory for all vehicles to be fitted with speed limiters.
